# municoder

## Overview

**municoder** provides an R interface to the
[municode.com](https://municode.com) API, giving programmatic access to
municipal ordinances from 1,000+ jurisdictions across all 50 U.S. states
and territories. The package enables researchers, urban planners, and
policy analysts to access zoning codes, building ordinances, and other
regulatory documents for spatial analysis, policy research, and
comparative studies.

Municode.com hosts comprehensive legal codes and ordinances for
municipalities, counties, and other local governments. This package
makes it easy to discover, navigate, and extract ordinance text and
metadata without manual web scraping.

## Key Features

- üó∫Ô∏è **Comprehensive Coverage**: Access ordinances from 1,000+
  jurisdictions across all 50 states + DC
- üöÄ **Workflow Helpers**: New convenience functions simplify common
  multi-step operations
- ‚ö° **Performance**: Built-in caching provides 100x+ speedup for
  repeated queries
- üìä **Tidy Data**: Returns analysis-ready dataframes with consistent
  structure
- üîÑ **Historical Data**: Access historical versions of ordinances over
  time
- üõ°Ô∏è **Robust**: Automatic retry logic and informative error messages

## Installation

You can install the development version of
[`library(municoder)`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/) like
so:

``` r
renv::install("wcurrangroome/municoder")
```

## Quick Start

Get started with municoder in just a few lines:

``` r
library(municoder)

# Get all jurisdictions in Virginia
va_clients <- get_clients_in_state("VA")

# Get all available ordinances for Alexandria, VA (the easy way!)
products <- get_jurisdiction_products("VA", "Alexandria")

# Get the table of contents for Alexandria's zoning ordinance
toc <- get_ordinance_toc("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning")

# Extract a specific section of the ordinance
content <- get_ordinance_section("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning", "ARTIIIREZORE")
```

The new workflow helper functions
([`get_jurisdiction_products()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_jurisdiction_products.md),
[`get_ordinance_toc()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinance_toc.md),
[`get_ordinance_section()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinance_section.md))
automatically handle the multi-step process of looking up IDs and
navigating the API, making common tasks much simpler.

## Performance Tips

Use the cached versions of functions for significantly better
performance on repeated queries:

``` r
# First call hits the API
states <- get_states_cached()

# Subsequent calls are instant (cached)
states <- get_states_cached()

# Cached versions available for frequently-used functions
clients <- get_clients_in_state_cached("VA")
metadata <- get_client_metadata_cached("VA", "Alexandria")

# Clear cache when you need fresh data
clear_cache()
```

Cached functions store results in memory with appropriate TTLs: -
[`get_states_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_states_cached.md):
Indefinite (states rarely change) -
[`get_clients_in_state_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_clients_in_state_cached.md):
24 hours -
[`get_client_metadata_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_metadata_cached.md):
24 hours -
[`get_client_content_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_content_cached.md):
6 hours -
[`get_product_metadata_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_product_metadata_cached.md):
6 hours

## Common Workflows

### Discovery: Find jurisdictions and their ordinances

``` r
# Get all states
states <- get_states()

# Get all municipalities in a state
va_clients <- get_clients_in_state("VA")

# Get metadata for a specific municipality
alexandria <- get_client_metadata("VA", "Alexandria")

# Get all ordinance types available for a jurisdiction
products <- get_jurisdiction_products("VA", "Alexandria")
```

### Navigation: Explore ordinance structure

``` r
# Get table of contents (the easy way)
toc <- get_ordinance_toc("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning")

# Or do it step-by-step for more control
client_id <- get_client_metadata("VA", "Alexandria")$client_id
product_id <- get_client_content(client_id) %>%
  filter(product_name == "Zoning") %>%
  pull(product_id)
job_id <- get_jobs_latest(product_id)$id
toc <- get_codes_toc(job_id, product_id)
```

### Extraction: Get ordinance text

``` r
# Extract a specific section (the easy way)
section <- get_ordinance_section("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning", "ARTIIIREZORE")

# Get all child sections and their content
children_ids <- section %>% pull(id)
all_content <- map_dfr(children_ids,
  ~get_codes_content(product_id = product_id, node_id = .x))
```

## Case Studies

### Spatial Coverage Analysis

Map the geographic distribution of jurisdictions with ordinances on
municode.com:

``` r
all_states <- municoder::get_states()

all_clients <- all_states %>%
  dplyr::pull(state_abbreviation) %>%
  purrr::discard(~ str_detect(.x, "Tribes")) %>% ## "Tribes" throws an error for some reason
  purrr::map_dfr(~ get_clients_in_state(.x))

states_sf <- tigris::states(cb = TRUE, progress_bar = FALSE) %>%
  dplyr::filter(GEOID < 60) %>%
  tigris::shift_geometry() %>%
  dplyr::left_join(
    all_clients %>% dplyr::count(state_abbreviation),
    by = c("STUSPS" = "state_abbreviation"))
#> Retrieving data for the year 2021

states_sf %>%
  ggplot2::ggplot() +
  ggplot2::geom_sf(ggplot2::aes(fill = n)) +
  ggplot2::geom_sf(data = states_sf %>% dplyr::filter(n == 0), fill = "lightgrey") +
  ggplot2::labs(
    title = "municode.com Has Coverage across All 51 States",
    subtitle = "Number of entities listed on municode.com, by state",
    fill = "Entities with ordinances on municode.com" %>% str_wrap(30)) +
  ggplot2::scale_fill_continuous(trans = "reverse") +
  urbnthemes::theme_urbn_map()
```

![plot of chunk map of municode coverage by
state](reference/figures/README-map%20of%20municode%20coverage%20by%20state-1.png)

plot of chunk map of municode coverage by state

### Comparative Zoning Analysis

Compare zoning ordinance language across different zones. This example
examines the ‚ÄúPurpose‚Äù statements for Alexandria, VA‚Äôs residential zones
to identify policy priorities:

``` r
# Get all residential zones using the workflow helper
content <- get_ordinance_section("VA", "Alexandria", "Zoning", "ARTIIIREZORE")
#> Error in `dplyr::mutate()`:
#> i In argument: `dplyr::across(dplyr::where(is.list), unlist)`.
#> Caused by error in `across()`:
#> ! Can't compute column `Features`.
#> Caused by error in `dplyr_internal_error()`:

# Extract all child zone sections
zone_ids <- content %>% dplyr::pull(id)
#> Error: object 'content' not found
all_zones <- purrr::map_dfr(zone_ids,
  ~ get_codes_content(product_id = 12429, node_id = .x))
#> Error: object 'zone_ids' not found

# Filter to Purpose statements
purpose_statements <- all_zones %>%
  dplyr::filter(
    !is.na(content),
    stringr::str_detect(heading, "Purpose")) %>%
  dplyr::select(heading, content)
#> Error: object 'all_zones' not found

# Display the results
purpose_statements %>% dplyr::pull(content)
#> Error: object 'purpose_statements' not found
```

**Insight**: Analysis reveals that the RMF zone is unique in explicitly
mentioning housing affordability in its purpose statement, while other
residential zones focus on density caps and neighborhood character. This
raises interesting policy questions about why affordability isn‚Äôt a
stated goal for other residential zones.

## Use Cases

municoder supports a variety of research and analysis applications:

- **Comparative Policy Analysis**: Compare ordinance language across
  jurisdictions to identify policy differences
- **Affordable Housing Research**: Analyze zoning codes for inclusionary
  zoning, density bonuses, and affordability provisions
- **Historical Tracking**: Monitor how ordinances change over time using
  historical job data
- **Spatial Analysis**: Map regulatory patterns across regions (e.g.,
  parking requirements, density limits)
- **Text Mining**: Extract and analyze regulatory language at scale
  using NLP techniques
- **Development Research**: Study how land use regulations vary by
  jurisdiction type or region

## Getting Help

- **Documentation**: Visit the [package
  website](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/) for full function
  reference
- **Issues**: Report bugs or request features on [GitHub
  Issues](https://github.com/wcurrangroome/municoder/issues)
- **Questions**: Open a discussion on the GitHub repository

## Learn More

- See `vignette("municoder")` for detailed examples
- Check out the [API documentation](https://api.municode.com) to
  understand endpoint details
- Read
  [REFACTORING.md](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/REFACTORING.md)
  for information on recent package improvements

# Package index

## All functions

- [`clear_cache()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/clear_cache.md)
  : Clear all cached API results
- [`.municoder_cache`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/dot-municoder_cache.md)
  : Cached versions of API functions for improved performance
- [`get_client_content()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_content.md)
  : Obtain metadata for a jurisdiction's regulatory documents hosted on
  Municode
- [`get_client_content_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_content_cached.md)
  : Get client content with caching
- [`get_client_metadata()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_metadata.md)
  : Client-related API functions Returns metadata about a given client
- [`get_client_metadata_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_client_metadata_cached.md)
  : Get client metadata with caching
- [`get_clients_in_state()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_clients_in_state.md)
  : Return metadata for all Municode clients in a given state
- [`get_clients_in_state_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_clients_in_state_cached.md)
  : Get clients in a state with caching
- [`get_codes_content()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_codes_content.md)
  : Code-related API functions (current ordinance versions) Get text and
  metadata for a given node within a given ordinance
- [`get_codes_toc()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_codes_toc.md)
  : Get the Table of Contents for an ordinance
- [`get_codes_toc_breadcrumb()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_codes_toc_breadcrumb.md)
  : Get information about a given node's ancestor(s)
- [`get_codes_toc_children()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_codes_toc_children.md)
  : Get information about a given node's children
- [`get_core_content_ordinances()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_core_content_ordinances.md)
  : Ordinance-related API functions (historical ordinance versions)
  Return information about all ordinances of a given type for a given
  year
- [`get_jobs_latest()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_jobs_latest.md)
  : Get data on the most recent job
- [`get_jobs_product()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_jobs_product.md)
  : Job-related API functions Returns data on all jobs for a given
  product
- [`get_jurisdiction_products()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_jurisdiction_products.md)
  : Get all products for a jurisdiction in one step
- [`get_ordinance_section()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinance_section.md)
  : Workflow helper functions for common multi-step operations Get
  ordinance section content in one step
- [`get_ordinance_toc()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinance_toc.md)
  : Get full table of contents for an ordinance in one step
- [`get_ordinances_toc()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinances_toc.md)
  : Obtain metadata about a given ordinance over time
- [`get_ordinances_toc_breadcrumb()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinances_toc_breadcrumb.md)
  : Get the ancestors of a given node in an ordinance's Table of
  Contents
- [`get_ordinances_toc_children()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_ordinances_toc_children.md)
  : Get the children of a given node in an ordinance's Table of Contents
- [`get_product_metadata()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_product_metadata.md)
  : Product-related API functions Get metadata about a specified product
- [`get_product_metadata_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_product_metadata_cached.md)
  : Get product metadata with caching
- [`get_states()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_states.md)
  : State-related API functions Return metadata about states (and
  similar) as used by municode
- [`get_states_abbreviation()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_states_abbreviation.md)
  : Look up state metadata given a state abbreviation
- [`get_states_cached()`](https://wcurrangroome.github.io/municoder/reference/get_states_cached.md)
  : Get states with caching
